entry.p: Been working on the TransformPages executable. I'm thinking of starting to review South Park episodes in the same manner as our dream to one day review all the Simpsons episodes. That being the case, I'm looking into more extensible methods for mass-transforming pages. Right now I use a one-to-one correspondence between an xml file and an xslt file to create a single html page. I'm going to loosen this requirement, first of all. Second, I'm going to try and restructure the site into a generic hierarchy, and attempt to make the already in place gallery and calendars pages fit into this hierarchy scheme.

I also found it necessary (out of boredom?) to remove all usage of 'font' elements from the site and increase stylesheet usage. This required a lot more work than I had anticipated, and it has left me feeling that even a well managed site (like I thought mine was) is very unmanagable. How the internet ever scaled up, I have no idea. It just sucks that we'll never be fully away from HTML 1.0.
Anyhow, I've updated some other stuffs too.
Updated the following items:

ul.li:
GenerateIndex.exe
slight change to the linking mechanism

entry.p: Updated some stuff, including summer gigs.

This update marks a huge step in this website's presence on the web. I now own the domain timski.info! I registered this domain through GoDaddy.com and got separate hosting through FatCow. I had to do some work on my end to get this all to work, mostly through updating my automated host script. Pretty soon I will host my brother's website, Sweet Movie Reviews, on the same host as Timski. We still have a lot of work to do before that goes out though. Look for sweetreviews.net to be up and running in the [near] future.

A few weeks ago I was working on another site, the upcoming badsimpsons.com. I copied many of the materials from this site over to that one, mainly the C# web tools that I wrote. As part of the badsimpsons effort, I did an overhaul of webtools, removing many dependencies and making them more portable (primarily removing the DataManager component). I then rolled those changes back into this site's source.
A few updates. The gallery will be down until I move to a different server. Gigs updated.
Added pictures of the kitties!!!

Finally bothered to add logging to the site. This is the simplest mechanism I have found so far to keep records of updates. Someday I'll have a git repository for that, but I'm waiting for the right operating system to come my way.
DataManager component and WebTools suite are well integrated.
The suite currently consists of the following tools:

ul.li: uses a string->list lookup to copy files in batches to managed locations
generates calendar month web pages from scratch based on data files and lookups
events get added to the calendar based on event list files
generates the image gallery web pages
generates the homepage and links it to all the other pages
